resources:
IQtest
Which number logically follows this series:

4, 6, 9, 6, 14, 6, ___? 19 If you rearrange the letters "CARACTTIN" you have the name of a(n):

continent, city, ocean, animal? ocean What is the next number in the series:

7, 10, 16, 28, 52, ___? 100 Apathetic is to sympathetic as ____________ is to concerned.

callous, compassionate, merciful, kind? callous A college professor teaches a class of 80 students. Fourteen students are business majors, six are education majors, and the rest are undecided.
What percentage of the class is undecided? 75 Afraid is to scared as brave is to _______.

courageous, cowardly, timid, trustworthy? courageous An organization hosts monthly meals for families in the community. In March, 70 people attended the meal. In April, 60 attended. Their highest attendance was in May, with 20 more than April.
What is their average monthly attendance? 70 If the first two statements are true, is the final statement true?

Mrs. Jones is responsible for collecting all of the fifth grade classes’ money for the school fundraiser.
Sally attends Mrs. Jones’ school.
Mrs. Jones is responsible for collecting Sally’s money for the fundraiser.

yes, no, uncertain? uncertain What is the missing number in the series:

3, 9, 81, 15, 21, 71, __, 33, 61? 27 Angie’s profits for March totaled $5400. If she profited nine times more in March than in April,
what were April’s profits? 600 What is the missing number in the series:

7, 12, 19, __, 39, 52? 28 A family is planning a vacation, traveling 300 miles from their house.

If they plan to stop at parks to allow the children to play every two hours,
how many parks will they visit before they reach their destination assuming they travel 60 mph? 2 The words gallant and valiant have ________ meanings.

same, opposite, unrelated? same Which of the following does not have the same meaning as the other words?

anxious, apprehensive, distressed, enthusiastic, concerned? enthusiastic What is the next number in the series:

4, 5, 11, 34, 137, __? 686 Accept and except have _________ meanings.

similar, different, unrelated? unrelated If a store sold 25 pairs of socks, making a 25% profit of $150,
how much did they charge for each pair? 24 The words allude and elude have ______ meanings.

same, opposite, unrelated? unrelated If the first two statements are true, is the third statement true?

Mr. Reed teaches all of the advanced math classes at his school.
Billy attends Mr. Reed’s school and is in an advanced math class.
Mr. Reed is Billy’s math teacher.

yes, no, uncertain? yes 250 people attended the first showing. Of the 250, 75 were adults above the age of 40, 50 were between the ages of 20 and 40, and 25 were teenagers ages 13–19.
What percentage of the attendees were children 12 and under? 40
Check I give up Are you sure you want to do this? Show Answer Cheating is wrong! Next Correct! Incorrect! Your score is ""
Your answer: Insert here
Testing is over.
Congratulations!
Your IQ is \ Do not worry. Be happy!
Learn and train… You are either a Nobel laureate or Bill Gates You have a very high intelligence You're a normal person
